Detailed Description

Status for a single traceroute.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum TrStatus::errCode

map all error codes from different processing phases of a traceroute

Per-traceroute error codes are between 1 and 499. General error codes start at 500. The ordering of the bunches of error numbers is roughly in order of the steps done to process a traceroute

Enumerator:
ERR_UNDEFINED  catch-all error code
ERR_PROCESS_START_FAIL  child process control
ERR_PROCESS_RC_BASE  map exit codes from child process starting here
ERR_NO_PUBLIC_HOPS  no public hops can happen if traceroute entirely within local address space
ERR_LE_MISSING_DATA  logic error!
ERR_HOST_NOT_FOUND  traceroute submission to server via HTTP
ERR_SERVER_POST_FAILED  TrHttp::finished() with error.
ERR_SERVER_MIN_CODE  map CGI program error codes into this space
ERR_SERVER_FAIL  CGI program emitting bad syntax.

Member Function Documentation

void TrStatus::finish ( long long  traceroute_id  ) 

Set the traceroute_id learnt from the server. The total elapsed time for the operation is also determined.

See also:
setError()

void TrStatus::setError ( int  errNum  ) 

set the error code for this traceroute

Parameters:
errNum is the error number
Set the error status code for this traceroute. The negative of the error code is stored into the traceroute_id field which under normal circumstances should always be positive.
See also:
finish()
